column1: Indaiatuba is a municipality in the state of São Paulo in Brazil. It is part of the Metropolitan Region of Campinas. The population is 251.600 (2019 est.) in an area of 311.55 km². The elevation is 624 m. The city's name derives from the Tupi language. It is an important city in one of Brazil's main industrial regions.
Based on the latest IFDM social index data
column2: Indaiatuba ranks number one of the "Top 100 best cities to live in

column1: The Federation of Industries of Rio de Janeiro
column2: surveyed data and compared information on education
column4: income and employment (wage and average generation of formal jobs) of all municipalities in the country and
column5: with this data they created the Firjan Development Index Municipal (IFDM)
column6: so it was possible to create the rank of the top 100 cities to live in Brazil.
